title: üìö Add Docker Setup Guide
body:
## Description
Create comprehensive Docker setup documentation with examples to make deployment easier for developers.

## Priority
High

## Labels
- documentation
- good-first-issue
- enhancement

## Tasks
- [ ] Add Dockerfile optimization guide
- [ ] Create docker-compose examples for development
- [ ] Add troubleshooting section for common Docker issues
- [ ] Include environment variable documentation
- [ ] Add production deployment examples

## Acceptance Criteria
- Complete Docker setup guide in README
- Working docker-compose.yml file
- Troubleshooting section with common issues
- Environment setup examples

## Estimated Time
2-3 hours

This is a great first issue for contributors wanting to improve infrastructure documentation!

title: Implement Voice Mode
body:
- Enable voice input using Web Speech API
- Add text-to-speech capabilities
- Implement voice command recognition
- Add configuration options for voice settings

title: Implement Mobile Responsiveness
body:
- Make UI fully responsive for mobile and tablet layouts
- Implement responsive design patterns
- Add media queries for different screen sizes
- Test on various devices and screen sizes

title: Implement Accessibility Improvements
body:
- Add ARIA labels to all interactive elements
- Implement semantic HTML structure
- Add keyboard navigation support
- Ensure proper focus management

title: Tests fail when DISPLAY_UNITS is configured to `mmol`
body:
**Describe the bug**

Several automated tests in the suite are failing when the `DISPLAY_UNITS` environment variable is set to `mmol` (for mmol/L) instead of the default mg/dl. These tests have hardcoded assertions or logic that expects glucose values and related messages to be in mg/dL. When the environment is configured for mmol/L, these assertions fail due to differing numerical values and unit strings (e.g., "9.4 mmol/L" vs. "170 mg/dL").

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Set up a NightScout dev environment
2. Modify the DISPLAY_UNITS to `mmol`
3. Run the test suite


## Impacted tests
For simple string issues:

* ar2.test.js
* boluswizardpreview.test.js
* timeago.test.js

### Calculation issues

`levels.WARN` appears to be `undefined` when `DISPLAY_UNITS` is set to mmol, since these tests pass when it is set to mg/dl. 

* boluswizardpreview.test.js
* simplealarms.test.js

title: Reserved words should be enforceable
body:
I used node-config for far too long before I discovered https://github.com/node-config/node-config/wiki/Reserved-Words

I even issued a PR (#705) meant to override it.

I ended up writing my own linter for the config/directory that checked for things like this. A utility method callable by users to do the same would be quite handy to have. Perhaps even a CLI to check things like this. 

Part of the failure mode here is that because of the way setImmutable and defineProperty works, there's a silent failure mode when the definition collision happens. For certain combination of property attributes, further attempts to modify the object simply become a no-op, with no exception. The changes I made in #705 were meant to address that but I now think in the wrong direction.

There may be a few lines of that PR that still should be brought forward, as IMO there are two bugs there.

title: Handle non-renderable content better
body:
When we are comparing non-text content that we know the browser can‚Äôt render inline (e.g. an Excel `.xlsx` file, but not a PDF), we should provide a better experience by displaying some basic information about the file, like the type, size, hash, and a download or ‚Äúview raw file‚Äù (or something along those lines) button.

Right now, we simply try and display the raw file contents if it‚Äôs not diff-able HTML, which can result in a file trying to auto-download in the browser and, afterward, a blank space in the comparison window. This is a pretty terrible experience! For example, this Excel file: https://monitoring.envirodatagov.org/page/3e7554b3-abb2-466e-b4f2-cf9ba73c3cea/d3053a25-61e6-4c90-ade0-545bad84f199..855d922c-a4b4-4890-b4ba-9187295352c0

The original goal was that we would develop a specialized diff or view for all kinds of file types, and that would solve this problem. But: we‚Äôll never handle *everything*, and we also don‚Äôt have the developer resources to easily expand on what we‚Äôve got in the near term, either. We need something better for media types we don‚Äôt [yet] support.

How this currently works:
- [`diff-types.js` has a map of media types to relevant diff/view types](https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/web-monitoring-ui/blob/790e2a664c9aee5a9511b8327f200467e652c675/src/constants/diff-types.js#L52-L73).
- [`ChangeView` looks up relevant diff types](https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/web-monitoring-ui/blob/790e2a664c9aee5a9511b8327f200467e652c675/src/components/change-view/change-view.jsx#L378-L387) from that map for the media type(s) being compared.
- [`DiffView` chooses the actual view to render based on the chosen diff type](https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/web-monitoring-ui/blob/790e2a664c9aee5a9511b8327f200467e652c675/src/components/diff-view.jsx#L132-L179).
- ‚Ä¶which will generally be either [`RawVersion`](https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/web-monitoring-ui/blob/790e2a664c9aee5a9511b8327f200467e652c675/src/components/raw-version.jsx#L18) or [`SideBySideRawVersions`](https://github.com/edgi-govdata-archiving/web-monitoring-ui/blob/790e2a664c9aee5a9511b8327f200467e652c675/src/components/side-by-side-raw-versions.jsx#L19).

We should probably have new `FilePreview` and `SideBySideFilePreview` views to use in cases where we don‚Äôt know we can actually render  the file inline. Constants for them will need to be added to `diff-types.js` and mapped to the views in `ChangeView`.

title: delete global custom ports
body:
Page: network/firewall

Cockpit can create and delete custom ports in a particular zone, but not global ones.

```
firewall-cmd --add-port=9119/tcp
```

This appears, but cannot be edited or removed:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/db18e466-01d4-40e1-805c-6ab5ebb4f919)

Enhancement instead of bug, as that's just how the firewall page is designed (around zones). But at least deletion may be simple enough, the counterpart of `firewall-cmd --remove-port=9119/tcp`

title: Legend state / samples checked not stored when modifying configuration
body:
Hello, 

I find your tool very useful for visualizing genome graph alignments computed for instance with Cactus and converted to .vg.
However, Cactus requires in input a Newick tree and generates 'fake' sequences for common ancestors.

This means that when visualizing my sample genomes I also have 'fake' ancestral genomes which I am not interested in.
In SequenceTubeMap I then uncheck all of the ~20 ancestral genomes from the 'Legend' so that the associated tracks are not displayed.
This works well, until I make any modification to the configuration, i.e. changing the reference, the region displayed, removing variants or node sequences, where then everything becomes checked again.

Unchecking all of the genomes manually is very tedious, would it be possible to store durably the legend configuration in the javascript backend? It would be nice to keep the state of how the samples are checked/unchecked for as long as the data itself (the .vg) is not changed.

Thank you very much in advance,
Maxime

title: Container overlays shouldn't be listed in Disks
body:
Page: Overview > View metrics and history > Disks

The Disks widget (?) shows a `/var/lib/containers/storage/overlay/.../merged` entry for every podman mount. It spams the small area and prevents you from seeing an overview of hardware that's mounted on the system. They should be filtered out, since they don't provide any additional value.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/84e3c032-6ad6-42ef-a1f9-07f8e10b29c6)

```
cockpit-311.2-1.el9_4
udisks2-2.9.4-9.el9

org.cockpit_project.CockpitClient 322 stable
```

title: [Bug Report] - Attempting to create a movie with no layers should report a warning
body:
**Describe the bug**
Attempting to create a movie with no layers will make an invalid API request.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Remove all data source layers
3. Attempt to create a movie

**Expected behavior**
It should just warn the user that they can't make a movie without selecting layers, as it does with screenshots.

**Screenshots**
Error when attempting to make a movie with no layers

title: make cockpit-desktop error message of bridge not found easier to understand
body:
### Explain what happens

1. forget to pass / as the first argument and do not have cockpit-bridge installed on the local system
2. `> /usr/lib/cockpit-desktop login@192.168.0.1`
3. See "Internal error in login process" in browser
4. close browser
5. get confused by wall of error messages in terminal

It maybe should stop after trying to run cockpit-bridge https://github.com/cockpit-project/cockpit/blob/main/src/ws/cockpit-desktop.in#L103 before starting the browser. Then it would only print the not found error message.

Maybe the error message is more understandable, if before trying it, print a message about what it is trying to do: "Accessing cockpit page login@192.168.0.1/index.hml on localhost by using URL: http://127.0.0.90/...." or "Accessing cockpit page / via ssh login@192.168.0.1 by using URL: http://127.0.0.90/...."

_No response_

Unknown or not applicable

### Server operating system

openSUSE

Chrome

title: Add revisionHistoryLimit to deployment
body:
### Description of the feature or enhancement:
Add option to set `revisionHistoryLimit` [.spec.revisionHistoryLimit](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#clean-up-policy)

### Use Case:
Default value of 10 replicasets will be selected and one might want to change this.

### Proposed Solution:
Adding this to deploymentProps
```
    /**
     * Number of desired replicasets history.
     *
     * @default 10
     */
    readonly revisionHistoryLimit?: number;
```

### Other:
N/A

* [ ] :wave: I may be able to implement this feature request
* [ ] :warning: This feature might incur a breaking change
---

This is a :rocket: Feature Request

title: Ability to view BG in clock view as mmol/l or mg/dl
body:
In the clock view the page only seems to display mg/dl and doesn't respect the user's settings on the main dashboard

I'd like to propse that a toggle style button is available on the clock view (in whatever variation) that allows for switching between the two different units.

I'd be happy to contribute by forking the project and coding this feature in. On first glance, the quickest route seems to be to alter the lib/client/clock-client.js file although more research might provide a better solution in terms of defaulting to the user's saved units setting when the clock appears.

Please see attached a mock-up of my suggestion:

![units-mock](https://github.com/nightscout/cgm-remote-monitor/assets/67185910/765b2514-06b4-4a0e-9286-1851ea246572)

title: Instructions for Adding an Additional Private Registry to Rancher and Downstream RKE2 Cluster
body:
## Related Issues

Somewhat Related - https://github.com/rancher/rke2/discussions/5302

## Summary

I needed to add an additional private registry to my Rancher provisioned RKE2 cluster, but did not want to use that private registry as the system registry for Rancher System Container Images.  The documentation linked from the Rancher UI points to instructions on how to add this to the individual nodes themselves, but not via the Rancher UI.  When I added to `/etc/rancher/rke2/registries.yaml` like the documentation suggests, that file gets wiped on reboot.  https://docs.rke2.io/install/containerd_registry_configuration/

## Details

Rancher 2.8.2
Downstream Cluster - RKE2 1.27.8

The only documentation I could find explaining how to add a private registry for containerd was here - https://docs.rke2.io/install/containerd_registry_configuration/ and that does not explain how to add it via the Rancher UI.  As I understand it, for this to work properly in a downstream RKE2 cluster provisioned by Rancher, you need to add this to the cluster config itself.  

When going to the Registries tab, it looks like your only option is to add a container registry for Rancher System Images, which is not what I wanted to do and would not work in our environment.

![image](https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/assets/4294930/33edc9c2-656e-41e4-9cd4-f24303bc371c)

Checking the box, again, makes it look like your only option is to add a registry for system images.

![image](https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/assets/4294930/97a2021b-3569-4281-b652-ff5d6cbfcda5)

Clicking "Show Advanced" opens other options, but it doesn't make it clear how you can add JUST an additional registry without changing the system registry.

![image](https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/assets/4294930/e4720e88-c29f-4d3d-a366-5fe72a7aadc5)

With the help of @brandond I was able to add an additional registry at the bottom, while leaving the top registry blank.  This isn't very intuitive and it's not noted anywhere in the UI.  Even the documentation linked in the UI is the standard RKE2 documentation that doesn't necessarily apply here. https://docs.rke2.io/install/containerd_registry_configuration/ 

There's also the issue of adding the CA Bundle.  It doesn't say what format it expects, when trying to paste in PEM format it throws a pretty generic Rancher Webhook error.  I thought the issue was with formatting from copy/paste.  It turns out you need to base64 encode the CA Bundle and then paste it in.  Ideally you could just use a configmap, which I already have loaded with that same CA bundle to work with helm.

Aside from changing the UI to be a little more intuitive and adding more helpful field descriptors, documentation describing these steps and caveats would be really helpful.

title: dashboard: `favicon` support
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-cli/discussions/9118
Originally posted by **melissavanbussel** March 17, 2024 ### Description Is it possible to add a favicon to a Quarto dashboard? I couldn't find any with favicons on the [examples page](https://quarto.org/docs/dashboards/examples/). For example, assume this is `dashboard.qmd`: ``` --- title: "My Quarto Dashboard" format: dashboard: favicon: logo.png logo: logo.png --- ``` The logo shows up on the dashboard, but the favicon doesn't. Thank you in advance for your help!

title: "Virtualization service (libvirt) is not active" tells me about wrong service
body:
On Fedora 40 (and perhaps elsewhere) the Virtualization Service that the "Virtual machines" tab indicates that:

![image](https://github.com/cockpit-project/cockpit-machines/assets/795070/c7033952-4623-402c-927c-2d89ab910a0a)

However, the service is called `virtqemud`

```
Failed to get libvirt version from the dbus API: 
Object { problem: null, name: "org.libvirt.Error", message: "Failed to connect socket to '/var/run/libvirt/virtqemud-sock': No such file or directory", toString: toString() }
```

and

```
$ sudo systemctl status libvirtd
Unit libvirtd.service could not be found.
$ sudo systemctl status virtqemud
‚óè virtqemud.service - libvirt QEMU daemon
...
```

Version:

```
cockpit-machines-308-1.fc40.noarch
```

title: List items are not scrollable when viewing Food Editor on mobile.
body:
**Describe the bug**
On a mobile device (Android or iOS), when I go to the Food Editor, only 2 (and a little bit of a 3rd) items are showing. I am not able to scroll the list. This works fine when viewing the Food Editor on a computer as the vertical scroll bar is present.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. On an Android or iPhone Go to 'Food Editor' from the hamburger menu.
2. Enter a few items into the Food Editor database (if you don't already have some).
3. Try to scroll the list to see all of the entered items.

**Expected behavior**
I would expect to be able to scroll up and down within the list of food items entered into the database.

**Your setup information**
- What version of Nightscout: 15.0.2
- What type of CGM, and how do you get your data there? Dexcom G7
- Is your issue specific to a browser (Firefox/Safari/Chrome?) or a device (Android phone, etc.)? Tried on Chrome/Android & Safari/iOS. Works fine on Chrome/PC.

title: Refresh technical content in the general FAQ
body:
## Related Issues
<!--
List any issues or tickets on other platforms that are associated with the request. For example, include a link to the issue tracking that feature in the Rancher repo, or list the Jira ticket number for the request.
-->

https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/issues/979

## Summary

<!--
Describe the requested update giving as much detail as possible. Please also list page link(s) in the current docs where the update applies.
-->

As observed in https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/issues/979, #980, and #983, the General FAQ has been a bit neglected. 983 did a copyedit, but we should also have a look at the technical information on that page and update as needed. 

I don't necessarily recommend adding more content to the page, as it could turn into a catchall for every request that passes by Jira or Slack.

title: Docs says that Authorized Cluster Endpoint is enabled by default
body:
Docs says that Authorized Cluster Endpoint is enabled by default for Rancher-launched clusters. It is not.

https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/blob/c7c9caa3e64033ea05c09a7288f7f31e3fedb83f/docs/reference-guides/cluster-configuration/rancher-server-configuration/rke2-cluster-configuration.md?plain=1#L234

![image](https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/assets/7773090/3f8c2244-6731-4893-99be-326aba5f1a83)

title: Missing documentation for `Satisfies` question field
body:
There exists a field `Satisfies` in the `Question` struct here:

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/blob/3be52d40943766a865ab6a0169317b07314c642c/pkg/apis/management.cattle.io/v3/catalog_types.go#L228

It is not documented here:


https://github.com/rancher/rancher-docs/blob/bcfd5b25aa8a74f6f719949393344f32e4c322e0/versioned_docs/version-2.7/how-to-guides/new-user-guides/helm-charts-in-rancher/create-apps.md?plain=1#L102-L130

body:

Edit : Note: Create separate issue if you have to improve particular components.
currently we are not focusing on desktop view so the UI improvement will be for mobile but we can also finalize some structure for Desktop by discussing.

title: add more web3 terms and definition
body:
## Task

Add more web3 terms and definitions to the `data.json` file. In the future, we'll migrate this to a proper server setup but right now, let's add more terms and definitions first.

## Instructions

- Open `data.json` inside the `src` folder.
- Add your terms and definition.
- Submit a PR on `dev` branch.

> **Note**: Don't create a single PR that contains a lot of new terms and definitions. I would recommend submitting a PR with a max of 10 terms and then describing your changes where you get your definition. It must be valid terms with reliable sources. Good luck and thank you for your awesome contribution!

title: Looking for maintaners
body:
Hello everyone. 

It's with sad news that I have to announce that I will be stopping maintaining this platform going forward. 

This is due to life and lack of disposable time on my part. 

If anyone would like to pick this up this repository then please feel free to reach out to me. I will still be active on github.

title: `cml publish` ignores paths with spaces
body:
I use `cml comment create --publish-native` to publish report with images. All images are uploaded correctly except images with with spaces in paths: `result/Some category/plot.png`. 

CML transformed my markdown`![]( result/Some category/pr_curve.png)` to `!\[]\( result/Some category/pr_curve.png)` (added some backslashes for some reason, didn't upload file).

When I transformed my path to contain `%20` instead of spaces, `![]( result/Some%20category/pr_curve.png)`, CML just put this in comment as is.

title: Allow customization of title to include link to folder level above
body: ### Bug description I have a blog that has the following directory structure: ```markdown $ tree . ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ 404.qmd ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _quarto.qmd ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ blog ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ welcome-to-my-blog ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ writing-papers-with-markdown ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd ``` When visiting the page for `welcome-to-my-blog`, there's current no way for a user to go back up just one level: It is possible for users to click on the `logo` icon to go to the home level though. It would be nice if this could be made to be like this instead: where `~` was clickable to get to the root level and `blog` was clickable to blog folder level. Ideally it would be customizable with what text we'd want to show there. You wouldn't need to add `/` like I have in the screenshot, users can probably customize that with css before and after selectors. Users can always hide this by setting `display: none`. What are your thoughts? I'm using `title: false` in the `navbar` but adding a link to the `logo` in the `_quarto.yml` for the screenshots above: ``` website: title: "kdheepak" favicon: ./_quarto/favicon.svg search: location: navbar site-url: https://kdheepak.com repo-url: https://github.com/kdheepak/kdheepak.github.io repo-actions: [edit, issue] open-graph: true twitter-card: true sidebar: alignment: left style: docked navbar: title: false logo: _quarto/favicon.svg collapse: false search: true pinned: false right: - icon: github href: https://github.com/kdheepak aria-label: GitHub - icon: rss href: index.xml aria-label: RSS ``` ### Checklist - [ ] Please include a minimal, fully reproducible example in a single .qmd file? Please provide the whole file rather than the snippet you believe is causing the issue. - [ ] Please [format your issue](https://quarto.org/bug-reports.html#formatting-make-githubs-markdown-work-for-us) so it is easier for us to read the bug report. - [ ] Please document the RStudio IDE version you're running (if applicable), by providing the value displayed in the "About RStudio" main menu dialog? - [ ] Please document the operating system you're running. If on Linux, please provide the specific distribution. - [ ] Please provide the output of `quarto check` so we know which version of quarto and its dependencies you're running.

title: What about the certificate on migrating Rancher to a new cluster?
body:
AFAICS the ingress certificate for the server hostname is managed outside of Rancher itself, either in a hand-crafted secret or by using a certificate manager.  https://ranchermanager.docs.rancher.com/v2.6/how-to-guides/new-user-guides/backup-restore-and-disaster-recovery/migrate-rancher-to-new-cluster should mention that this certificate is not part of the migration procedure. 

Or is it?

title: Documentation how to use EncryptionConfiguration for Rancher Backups with AWS KMS on AWS EKS clusters
body:
**Summary:**
There are example provisioned about EncryptionConfiguration how to use non-KMS EncryptionConfiguration - https://ranchermanager.docs.rancher.com/v2.6/reference-guides/backup-restore-configuration/examples#example-encryptionconfiguration

However, there is no information how to use KMS plugin on AWS EKS clusters within EncryptionConfiguration. AWS EKS controlplane does not expose this information. Do I need to deploy my own encryption provider? Can I use one that runs on EKS control plane? How to configure this? Working example of such EncryptionConfig would be very welcome.

title: add mention of climatologies to Help
body:
At present, all data in PCEX is 30 year climatologies, though it does not have to be that way; PCEX is also capable of displaying non-climatological datasets.

We have had some questions about what the years on the graphs mean - might be nice to add to help somewhere that they are climatological means.

title: Be able to create arm-based CML runners on AWS
body:
Right now, `cml runner` command can only launch `amd64` based EC2 instances, as there is only an AMI for this architecture available.

Would be great if there was also support for `arm`-based instances (all the `-g` ones), as AWS has a pretty large offering of them, and they can be more cost-effective than those with Inter/AMD processors

title: Incorrect statement on number of cluster agents
body:
**Summary:**
Documentation at https://docs.ranchermanager.rancher.io/reference-guides/rancher-manager-architecture/communicating-with-downstream-user-clusters#2-cluster-controllers-and-cluster-agents incorrectly states a cluster has one cluster agent.

**Details:**
The text is:
> There is one cluster controller and one cluster agent for each downstream cluster.

However, in a cluster, seeing two:
```
$ kubectl get pods -n cattle-system | grep cattle-cluster-agent
cattle-cluster-agent-85fd974484-m8gpk        1/1     Running   0          7d7h
cattle-cluster-agent-85fd974484-gmbsb        1/1     Running   0          7d7h
```
Should check with engineering. In some cases there is only 1.

title: Blockquotes?
body:
Does Raneto support blockquotes in Pages without custom CSS work? If so, what is the Markdown syntax or HTML markup? I've tried using `>` and `
` but those doesn't seem to work. Apologies if I'm just missing something obvious. Thanks for making Raneto!

title: Allow `-cloud-startup-script` to specify a file
body:
Currently, only a base64 encoded string can be passed to `-cloud-startup-script`.

It would be more convenient if a path to a file (script) could be specified

title: BASE_URL and sub-directories.
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to set it up behind a nginx reverse proxy under a sub directory but although I've got the nginx side up and running (I think), it keeps trying to load some files using the root url (e.g. <url>/bundle/js/bundle.app.js instead of <url>/ns/bundle/js/bundle.app.js). Having read the docs, I though BASE_URL set to <url>/ns would correct this but it doesn't seem to. Does BASE_URL do something else? If so, is there an envvar for my use case?

Thanks.

title: [Rancher2] Single Node Using Docker fails with cgroups v2
body:
**Request Summary:**

It seems to be a known issue that the single node docker install does not work on operating systems using the newer cgroups v2.
Therefore I would suggest adding a section to the installation page warning about that fact and pointing the users to a k3s + helm setup.

Maybe similar to how its done here: https://rancher.com/docs/rancher/v2.6/en/backups/restoring-rancher/#known-issues

**Details:**
- [Documentation Link](https://rancher.com/docs/rancher/v2.6/en/installation/other-installation-methods/single-node-docker/)

**Some example issues from [rancher/rancher](https://github.com/rancher/rancher/issues)**
- https://github.com/rancher/rancher/issues/37225
- https://github.com/rancher/rancher/issues/37210

<!-- If you have specific content you want changed, please indicate this below this line. -->

title: New host key confirmation should have an entry to confirm the results of ssh-keyscan
body: When adding a new host where the key needs to be checked, it probably makes sense to have a means to copy/paste the results of ssh-keyscan to verify it matches with what Cockpit is getting, instead of having to visually compare the keys.

title: dogfood `cml` across org
body:
Find-and-replace actions[^1][^2] org-wide with CML commands instead (See https://github.com/iterative/cml/issues/1017)

- [ ] [`peter-evans/create-pull-request`](https://github.com/peter-evans/create-pull-request) -> `cml pr`
- [ ] [`LouisBrunner/checks-action`](https://github.com/LouisBrunner/checks-action) -> `cml send-github-check`
- [ ] [`peter-evans/create-or-update-comment`](https://github.com/peter-evans/create-or-update-comment) -> `cml send-comment`
  + [ ] maybe requires fixing default token first? https://github.com/iterative/cml/issues/1105?


[^1]: https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aiterative+peter-evans&type=code
[^2]: https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aiterative+checks-action&type=code

title: github action to ask if allow to do the npm publish
body:
Today, we have the `ci.yml` file having the last step responsible to do a release into the NPM.

We want to add a step before this one to make available allow or not to do this publish on NPM or add a new rule to check if the branch or tags has a specific combination of words and then if having made the release.

we could go with one of both ideas:
- [ ] add a step do ask if allow doing the npm publish
- [ ] or add a rule to check if the branch being merged has a specific name and if it is a specific one related to the release enabling to make the release on NPM

title: Move codebase to ES6
body:
This would be a big task but I think there will be lots of benefits in terms of code-readability (especially with template-literals) and a few performance improvements either.

This could be also distributed to PR-per-package:

- [ ] blaze
- [ ] blaze-tools
- [x] caching-html-compiler (PR: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/390)
- [ ] html-tools (PR: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/385)
- [ ] htmljs (PR: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/385)
- [ ] observe-sequence
- [ ] spacebars
- [ ] spacebars-compiler
- [ ] spacebars-tests
- [x] templating-compiler (PR: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/389)
- [ ] templating-runtime
- [ ] templating-tools
- [x] ui (PR: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/391)

In an optimum there would be no changes to the functionality at all.

- [x] PR for adding a linter: https://github.com/meteor/blaze/pull/382

title: ci: user name/email convenience options
body:
Provide convenience automations with new flag(s):

- `--user-commit`: name=`git log -1 --pretty=format:'%an'`, email=`git log -1 --pretty=format:'%ae'`
- `--user`: name=`$GITHUB_ACTOR`, email=`$GITHUB_ACTOR@users.noreply.github.com` ([interesting quirks](https://github.community/t/who-will-be-the-github-actor-when-a-workflow-runs-on-a-schedule/17369))
- `--user-driver`: name=`gh api user --jq .login`, email=`gh api user --jq .email`

Follow-up to #945 <- #942.

title: Need more designs for static cursors.
body: Looking for `designers` who can help design some new trendy cursors for the library.

title: Styling: border-shortcut only working with certain order of arguments
body:
**Describe the bug**
The border-shortcut (and borderTop etc. respectively) is only working when the arguments are in the following order: width, style, color. This contradicts the general CSS spec: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/border

Certain orders do not apply the styles, other orders lead to an error. See https://codesandbox.io/s/admiring-sun-epi6q1. wrongOrderBorder2 in the Sandbox leads to an error for example.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Browser: Chrome
 - React-pdf version: 2.1.1

title: Clock views don't show when token auth is used
body:
**Describe the bug**
If a token is passed in as part of the url it is not propagated to subsequent views like clock views. Those do not show data.

**To Reproduce**
- Turn off unauthorized access
- Create a role with readable access
- authenticate on site with inline token like `https://yoursitename.herokuapp.com/?token=school-a595d5f0aeff64c0`
- open menu and select a clock view
- see nothing 

**Expected behavior**
In my opinion, the token passed in as part of the url should propagate to subsequent urls on site. 
Clock-View URL is now: `https://yoursitename.herokuapp.com/clock/bgclock` and should instead be `https://yoursitename.herokuapp.com/clock/bgclock?token=school-a595d5f0aeff64c0`

**setup information**
- Nightscout 14.2.5 on Heroku
- tested in Firefox and Chrome

title: selinux: Add a way to select all (to make dismissing easier)
body:
Since we don't have filtering (and I'm not sure if we need on the SELinux page), selecting all is probably enough, so I'd suggest the table with the checkbox above.

https://www.patternfly.org/v4/guidelines/bulk-selection/#bulk-selection-and-global-actions

This would let someone apply fixes for individual issues first, select, all and then dismiss everything.

As the SELinux list can get quite long, this would be a welcome improvement.

title: Namespace requests aren't marked as such in generated issue
body:
As seen in https://github.com/spdx/license-list-XML/issues/1414, license **namespace** requests produce GitHub issues which are indistinguishable from those made by normal license requests.

The generated GitHub issues should specify that the request is for a license namespace; for instance, the issue title:
> New license request: ae [SPDX-Online-Tools]

could become:
> New license namespace request: ae [SPDX-Online-Tools]

title: Add information on Changelogs.
body:
- Section: [Contributor Friendly Repository](https://harshkapadia2.github.io/git_basics/#_contributor_friendly_repository)
- Learn about Changelogs and add that information **in your own words** in `changelog.adoc` in the https://github.com/HarshKapadia2/git_basics/tree/main/src/content/contributor_friendly_repo directory.
	- Make sure to add a reference to the file in the https://github.com/HarshKapadia2/git_basics/blob/main/src/refs/contributor_friendly_repo.adoc file.
- Make sure to read the https://github.com/HarshKapadia2/git_basics/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md file fore more instructions.
- Feel free to reference any resources to add information. **It would be better to reference multiple resources.**
	- Eg: [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.1.0)
- Write about a changelog is, the need for a changelog, the format of a changelog, when to update a changelog, etc.

title: Avoid importing entire lodash package
body: This package uses `import _ from 'lodash'`, instead it should import only the functions it needs.

title: Modernize screens and components
body: With React v16 and the upgrade to react-navigation, many of the components can be modernized to use hooks and share code

title: Fix nested screen header styles
body: Due to the react-navigation upgrade, it looks like the chat screen header styles no longer match the main navigation. Notice the bottom border is now stronger. ### Expected ### Actual

title: Obviate the need to transpile TS
body: We currently need to ensure that the TypeScript in this repo is transpiled in order for the latest changes to be present, even if referencing this Action `@master`.  We need a better way to ensure that this implicit step is made more obvious so others don't lose time wondering why their latest code does not seem to work.

title: Make node_modules not required
body:
This action currently requires `node_modules` to be included in the repo because (we think) our `package.json` does not include a `preBuild` or `build` stage like <https://github.com/pulumi/actions/blob/master/package.json>.

Make this repo work like <https://github.com/pulumi/actions/> so we don't need to include `node_modules`.

body:
Hi Guys ,

title: Without the Hot Air v1.1
body: ## Tasks * [ ] Format math equations properly (using remark-math?) * [ ] Proofing * [ ] remove websitetitle stuff e.g. `doi:10.1016/0196-8904(95)00306-1` `[www.ingentaconnect.com/content/els/01968904/1996/00000037/00000006/art00306](http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/els/01968904/1996/00000037/00000006/art00306)` * [ ] Fix internal chapter links e.g. currently a link to chapter 24 has link https://climate.lifeitself.us/without-hot-air/Text/chap24.xhtml#lithium * [ ] Revision / corrections #16 * [ ] add annotation - see https://h.readthedocs.io/projects/client/en/latest/publishers/ * [ ] Revised / updated version (v2 - keep source as v1) Someday maybe * [ ] Nicer table of contents e.g. 3 col, color-coded like on https://www.withouthotair.com * [ ] (?) generate table of contents from structured data (e.g. json)

title: Colour / color themes.
body:
- [x] Document / list hex codes for themes in v5
- [ ] Create a way of changing your colours by changing a theme in v6. Note this is not for the config / overall UI - just dasher zooming pane and elements. 

As a dasher user I'm used to changing colours of the zooming interface by selecting a color theme. This is useful because some of these themes have been in existence a long time - but also some of these themes feel easier particularly for dasher novices.

title: Badges for repos
body:
As a GitHub user / developer i
Would like to see at a glance key aspects of each repo in badges in each readme

Notably :
- Build status (linking with GitHub actions)
- openAAC affiliation
- license 


Ref https://naereen.github.io/badges/

title: Runner package is downloaded every single time
body:
Would be faster if we can reuse the already downloaded one, this is specially good for not cloud runners.
We should download the wrapped runner once (GH or GL), install it in the system and make ```cml-runner``` to use it always.
If we are changing the SCM we should download the other wrapped runner.

title: It should be safe to delete the CSS folder you don't need in /content
body:
> ‚ÄúIn the content area you will find two folders: postcss and sccs. The one you will use depends on your preference in your configuration. It should be safe to delete the folder you don't need.‚Äù

Test this.

title: Add dynamic reconfiguration implementation to the examples.
body:
Thank's to [this PR](https://github.com/yfinkelstein/node-zookeeper/pull/273/), there is now possible to setup dynamic reconfiguration!

There is an `examples` folder with fully functional code on how to use this library. But the new feature added is not there yet. 

Create an example using the style of the other modules in there and call the function from the entry point, or somewhere else where appropriate.

title: Support dark mode
body:
The Dasher Version Six user interface (UI) should support dark mode.

The control panel and other parts of the UI that are like a web page should have a CSS colour scheme that changes based on the current preference, for example by including a `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)` query. The pagebuilder.css file from the Captive Web View project already has colour scheme that is mostly suitable.

The zooming part of the UI should also have different colours in light and dark modes. One approach could be as follows.
-   In light mode, same colours as current.
-   In dark mode, no fill colours but show white outlines and white text.

body:
We need to update icon-font-generator to fantasticon and keep the same functionality.

Current package used: https://www.npmjs.com/package/icon-font-generator
New package: https://github.com/tancredi/fantasticon

title: Add pulumi/pulumi_stack select
body:
We should add a `pulumi/stack_select` orb. It isn't needed in many situations, because you can add a `--stack` flag to the `up` or `preview` commands.

However, when using Pulumi in CI and creating ephemeral environments you need to "select a stack, or create it if it is the first time referencing it". (https://github.com/pulumi/circleci/pull/30 describes this type of situation.)

By having a way to express `pulumi stack select` via an orb, it would be easier to use Pulumi in CircleCI.

title: ES Modules Compatibility
body:
Thank you for your job in this library!

I'd like to suggest making it ES module compatible, it wouldn't require much, just a matter of exporting the functions using the `export` function and importing modules using the `import` keyword.

My suggestion, to keep compatibility with Node is to have a single version that would then "compile" into the others (as there are versions of Node that still don't support ESM)

This change would also make it possible to use this library on Deno (https://deno.land/). 

If you're willing to do it, I'm eager to help!
